docs.lead_paragraph: Fewer people are dying before the age of 65, another indication that Americans are taking better care of themselves, according to Government health researchers. As a way of learning what is causing early deaths in the country, the Federal Centers for Disease Control monitor what they call ''years of potential life lost'' by Americans who die before the 65th birthday. The total number of years lost to early death dropped 3 percent from 1982 to 1983, from 9.43 million years to 9.17 million, the centers said recently.
